instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: I have problem here. Board 820-3024-b no powering up. I have 8.4v on    PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS    not sure what to do next. any help?

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: yes i have 3.3v on PP3V3_S5 and green light on charger

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: PP5V_S3 is coming high at least for a split of a second???? Water damage??? Any history about the reason of the fail???

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: no water damaged.  guy in one of shops fitted screen with battery connected and short motherboard.  PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS  is only 8.4v

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: 8.4V is normal. Check all coils for shorts to GND.

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: I have  short on  PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG .  r7641 pin 1 short. removed c7623, c7648, c7649 still sort on pin 1 r7641. also i removed R7642, C7640, R7641 still short. any idea?

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: A low resistance is normal on this rail, what is the resistance to ground on L7630??

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: Uhm that means the board is powered up! Is a USB mouse lighting up when plugged in? Is there an image on the screen, check with flashlight.

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: when i press power button usb mouse lights up so looks like is powered up but fan is no spinning even i changed for another one and screen is black. i used light behind screen and is not showing anything.it was job from another shop who was trying to change screen for new one. and this is new screen fitted. is that mean is different emc number screen fitted?

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: Fan should spin. Is there voltage on L7510? Did you try with a known good LCD?

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message:
L7510 : 0.001v
and there is 5.15v on pin 1 of fan connector J5600
this screen is brand new with stickers on it but i never try another screen . even that fan should spin when even screen is not connected

threads.title: 820-3024-b  no powering up
threads.message: There is a voltage missing. I bet ALL_SYS_PWRGD is low. If it is then it is up to you to find which voltage rail is missing.
